alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 2:09PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of , the southeastern City of Norfolk, the central City of Chesapeake, the southeastern City of Portsmouth and the City of Virginia Beach through 300 PM EDT... At 208 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles northeast of Norfolk International to near Fentress to near Chesapeake. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Virginia Beach, Virginia Wesleyan University, Regent University, Great Bridge, Kempsville, Deep Creek, Norfolk State University, Norfolk, Chesapeake, Portsmouth, Back Bay, Fentress, Norfolk International, Norview, Northwest, Cradock, Princess Anne, South Norfolk, Rudee Heights and Portlock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
